description: ERECTION OF A DOUBLE HEIGHT GLASS GARDEN ROOM IN THE FORM OF A TWO STOREY REAR EXTENSION, CONVERSION OF THE EXISTING GARAGE INTO A HABITABLE ROOM, REPLACEMENT OF THE EXISTING FENESTRATION WITH DOUBLE GLAZED WINDOWS AND INSERTION OF 3 ROOF-LIGHTS TO THE FRONT ROOF SLOPE
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Drawing no: (Location Plan) Dated 30/04/ 2024 
Drawing no: 091_G201_AP Rev C

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be  with The First floor glazing to the Eastern Side Elevation to facing No: 15 Cedar Court to be Opaque Glassthose as  specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Obscured Glazing (Fixed Shut) - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the east flank elevation shall be glazed with obscure glass and fixed shut and shall permanently maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
http://www.planningportal.gov.uk/buildingregulations/buildingpolicyandlegislation/current legislation/partywallact

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   iii) The application was approved without delay.
   iv) The application was considered by the Planning Committee where the applicant/agent had the opportunity to speak to the committee and promote the application.
